title: Microsoft SharePoint Foundation 2013 - Master SharePoint
headline: Discover how to master the features and functionalities of Microsoft SharePoint with this free online sharepoint course.
description: This free online Microsoft SharePoint Foundation training course will teach you about how Microsoft's SharePoint can make team collaboration more effective and productive. You'll study what a List and Library are as well as learn how to add internal users and add users to different groups. This course will also teach you how to use the Ribbon, import an Excel workbook into SharePoint, work offline and online, and much much more!

courseDescription:
Discover how to make team collaboration more effective and productive with this online video course on SharePoint Foundation 2013. The course starts off with what SharePoint does, and teaches you the basics of using SharePoint, such as using help, creating a new site, adding contents to the site, and more. You will also learn about SharePoint lists and libraries and their uses.

Next, the course introduces you to user groups and permission levels, after which you will be taught about the ribbon in SharePoint, how to delete items, how the recycle bin works, and how to restore deleted items. Then you will learn about integrating SharePoint with other MS Office applications such as Excel and Access. Finally, you will learn about collaborating with other users on the same document in SharePoint and working offline and how that affects you and your material. You will also learn about the types of pages, adding and deletion of pages, basic editing and how history and versioning works in SharePoint.

Many modern businesses use team collaboration software as a core part of their communication systems, so being confident in using a software package such as SharePoint is of vital importance for any employee. So start this free course today, and by the end of the week you’ll have developed new skills for using SharePoint 2013.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Discover how to make team collaboration more effective and productive with this online video course on SharePoint Foundation 2013.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn how to Navigate a SharePoint site, and how to navigate the SharePoint browser-based help. You'll also learn how to create a subsite, change and add contents to a site. The module covers how to create a SharePoint site, add pages to your SharePoint site, add a web part to a page, and add an app to your SharePoint site.
topics: Main Navigational Features and SharePoint Help

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn what a List is and what a library is in SharePoint. You'll learn how to create and delete lists, and create a library on a SharePoint site. The module also covers how to create new documents and add documents to a library, and upload a document to your SharePoint site.
topics: What are Lists and Libraries; Creating Lists

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn how to add internal users, and add users to different groups. The module covers how to create groups and set their settings. You'll learn how to recognize the different levels of permissions, and add and create a custom permission levels.
topics: Users Groups and Permission - Learning Outcomes
Setting Up Users and Creating Groups
Exercise 1: Create a Sublevel Site and  Setup Users
Users Groups and Permission - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: The Ribbon, Recycle Bin, and Integration with Office
modules.description: In this module you'll learn how to use the Ribbon in SharePoint. The module also covers how to delete and restore documents, set the storage quota in SharePoint, and integrate SharePoint with MS Office applications such as Word.
topics: The Ribbon, Recycle Bin, and Integration with Office - Learning Outcomes
Deleting and Restoring Documents, Storage Quota
Detailed Look at Integration between SharePoint and MS Office
Exercise 2: Setup Logo and Title, Remove Links, and Change Style
The Ribbon, Recycle Bin, and Integration with Office - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn how to import an Excel workbook into SharePoint, export a list or a library from SharePoint to Excel, and export a spreadsheet from Excel to SharePoint.
topics: SharePoint and MS Excel - Learning Outcomes
Exercise 3: Export Relevant Data on Excel into the Subsite
SharePoint and MS Excel - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn how to export an Access table as a list to SharePoint. The module also covers how to share an Access database or tables to SharePoint, and save an Access database to SharePoint.
topics: SharePoint and MS Access - Learning Outcomes
Moving Data between Access Databases and SharePoint
Moving MS Access Tables to SharePoint Subsite
SharePoint and MS Access - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about the differences between working offline and online. The module also covers how to Sync libraries on SharePoint to your local PC. You'll learn how to use the check-in and check-out function for making sure nobody edits or works on document you’re working on. The module looks at versioning for different documents, lists and libraries in SharePoint, and shows you how to use Co-Authoring, to collaboratively work on the same document at the same time.
topics: Collaboration and Working Offline - Learning Outcomes
Syncing Libraries to your Local PC using Skydrive Pro
Exercise 4: Upload Docs to Document Library, Enable Versioning and Create Versions, Setup Offline Working
Collaboration and Working Offline - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about the different types of Pages you can make for a SharePoint site. You'll learn how to identify the purposes for why you would use each type of page. The module also covers how to edit and change the contents, format and layout of pages, as well as how to add or create a page.
